summary: An FBI internal email chain from September-October 2020 regarding the approval of funding and travel for FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the New York Field Office to travel to the United Kingdom to interview a key witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The witness was described as being part of Epstein and Maxwell's circle for several years and unwilling to discuss details over video conference.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation for which the witness is being interviewed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the investigation for which the witness is being interviewed.

events.title: Planned UK Witness Interview Trip
events.description: FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from SDNY planned to travel to the United Kingdom to conduct an in-person interview over three days with a key witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Travel Request Approved
events.description: Operational travel for FBI personnel to interview a witness in the UK was officially approved, with funding authorized.

keyFacts: In October 2020, the FBI and SDNY were actively pursuing a key witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case who was located in the United Kingdom.
The witness was described as having been 'a part of Epstein and Maxwell's circle for several years' and was anticipated to provide significant information.
The witness refused to discuss the matter at length over video conference, necessitating an in-person interview, for which a 3-day period was planned.
The travel involved two FBI agents from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad and two Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The email chain details the bureaucratic process for securing funding and approval for international operational travel within the FBI.
